verses.verse: (The Second Epistle of John) ((This Epistle is written to a woman of great renown, 4 who brought up her children in the fear of God: 6 he exhorteth her to continue in Christian charity,7 that she accompany not with Antichrists,10 but avoid them.) ) The Elder to the (This is no proper name, but to be taken as the word soundeth, that is to say to the worthy and noble Lady.) elect (Excellent and honorable Dame.) Lady, and her children, (The bond of Christian conjunction or linking together, is the true and constant profession of the truth.) whom I love in the truth: and not I only, but also all that have known the truth,
For the truthâ€™s sake which dwelleth in us, and shall be with us forever:

Grace be with you, mercy and peace from God the Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ the Son of the Father, with (With true knowledge, which hath always love joined with it, and following it.) truth and love.

(This true profession consisteth both in love one toward another which the Lord hath commanded, and also especially in wholesome and sound doctrine, which also is delivered unto us: for the commandment of God is a sound and sure foundation both of the rule of manners and of doctrine, and these cannot be separated the one from the other.) I rejoiced greatly, that I found of thy children walking in (According as the truth directeth them.) truth, as we have received a commandment of the Father.
And now beseech I thee, Lady, (not as writing a new commandment unto thee, but the same which we had from the beginning) that we (Cross references: : John 15:12) love one another.
And this is that love that we should walk after his commandments. This commandment is, that as ye have heard from the beginning, ye should walk in it.

(Antichrists fighting against the person and office of Christ, were already crept into the Church in the time of the Apostles.) For many deceivers are entered into this world, which confess not that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh. He that is such one, is a deceiver and an Antichrist.
Look to yourselves, that we lose not the things, which we have done, but that we may receive a full reward. (He that maketh shipwreck of doctrine, loseth all.) (Beware and take good heed.)
Whosoever transgresseth, and abideth not in the doctrine of Christ, hath not God. He that continueth in the doctrine of Christ, he hath both the Father and the Son.
(We ought to have nothing to do with them that defend perverse doctrine.) If there come any unto you, and bring not this doctrine, (Rom. 16:17) receive him not to house, neither bid him Godspeed.

For he that biddeth him Godspeed, is partaker of his evil deeds. Although I had many things to write unto you, yet would I not write with paper and ink: but I trust to come unto you, and speak mouth to mouth, that our joy may be full.
The sons of thine elect sister greet thee, Amen.
